data.title: Kenny “Babyface” Edmonds
data.text:
Kenny “Babyface” Edmonds is one of the most celebrated creative forces in music history. As a recording artist, songwriter and producer he has earned 11 Grammys® and created 26 number-one R&B hits and over 50 Top 10 Pop hits including 16 Number 1’s.

He was presented top awards from American Music Awards and The Soul Train Awards. He received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2013 and was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2017. His smooth, soulful voice has touched audiences for over five decades during which he released three consecutive multi-platinum albums: Tender Lover, For the Cool in You, and The Day. He has collaborated with some of the biggest artists in music, including Whitney Houston, Michael Jackson, Eric Clapton, Bruno Mars, Boyz II Men, Bobby Brown, Toni Braxton, and TLC creating the soundtrack for millions of lives around the world. His music catalogue of singles and albums have tallied hundreds of millions streams and sales worldwide forever changing the history of music.
